  • Low-Level API
    • Prerequisites
    • 1. Ingest a Dataset
      • Object Relational Model (ORM)
      • a) Registering Datasets
        • Dataset.Tabular
        • Dataset.Sequence
        • Dataset.Image
      • b) Reading Datasets into Memory
        • Dataset.Tabular
        • Dataset.Sequence
        • Dataset.Image
    • 2. Selecting Features and Labels.
      • a) Select the Label column(s).
        • ORM
        • Deriving Labels
        • Reading Labels
      • b) Select the Feature column(s).
        • ORM
        • Specifying Features
        • Reading Features
    • 3. Slicing samples.
      • a) Define sliding time series Windows.
        • ORM
        • Specifying Windows
        • Reading Windows
      • b) Slice samples with a Splitset.
        • Stratification
        • Splitting Strategies
        • Reading Splitsets
      • c) Create a Foldset for cross-validation.
        • ORM
        • Fold objects
        • Specifying Foldsets
        • Reading Foldsets
    • 4. Preprocessing - Interpolation.
      • ORM
      • a) Interpolate Labels with LabelInterpolater.
      • b) Interpolate Features with Interpolaterset.
    • 5. Preprocessing - Encoding.
      • Encoding
      • a) Encode labels with LabelCoder.
        • Creating a LabelCoder
      • b) Encode Features sequentially with Ensoderset.
        • Filtering feature columns
    • 6. Preprocessing - Reshaping.
      • ORM
      • Reshaping by Index
      • Reshaping Explicitly
      • Multiplicative Reshaping
    • 7. Defining Architectures & Hyperparameters.
      • a) Define an Algorithm
        • Model Definition
        • Group the functions together in an Algorithm!
      • b) Combinations of hyperparameters with Hyperparamset.
        • Hyperparameter Selection Strategies.
        • Hyperparamcombo objects.
    • 8. Queue of training Jobs.
      • a) Job objects.
      • b) Executing Jobs.
        • i) queue.run_jobs()
        • ii) DEPRECATED - queue.run_jobs(in_background=True).
      • c) Predictors are the trained models.
        • Fetching the trained model.
      • d) Predictions are the output of a Predictor.
        • Fetching metrics.
    • 9. Metrics & Visualization
  • Inference

Keras: Image Classify BinaryÔÉÅ

Brain Tumor Detection via Binary Classification of Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) Scans

[2]:

import aiqc
from aiqc import datum

PipelineÔÉÅ

This dataset is comprised of:

  • Features = folder of magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of brain samples.

  • Labels = tabular data denoting the presence of a tumor.

[3]:

from sklearn.preprocessing import FunctionTransformer
from aiqc.utils import div255, mult255

[4]:

img_splitset = aiqc.Pipeline.Image.make(
    # --- Label preprocessing ---
    label_df_or_path = datum.to_pandas('brain_tumor.csv')
    , label_dtype = None
    , label_column = 'status'
    , label_interpolater = None
    , label_encoder = None

    # --- Feature preprocessing ---
    , feature_folder_or_urls = datum.get_remote_urls(manifest_name='brain_tumor.csv')
    , feature_dtype = 'float64'
    , feature_interpolaters = None
    , feature_window = None
    , feature_encoders = dict(#pixel values are 0-255 so we will standardize by dividing by 255.
        sklearn_preprocess= FunctionTransformer(div255, inverse_func=mult255)
        , dtypes = 'float64'
    )
    , feature_reshape_indices = (0,2,3)#reshape for Conv1D grayscale.

    # --- Stratification ---
    , size_test = 0.22
    , size_validation = 0.14
    , fold_count = None
    , bin_count = None
)

ModelingÔÉÅ

[16]:

import tensorflow as tf
from tensorflow.keras import layers as l
from aiqc.utils import TrainingCallback

[11]:

def fn_build(features_shape, label_shape, **hp):
    m = tf.keras.models.Sequential()

    # Convolutional block.
    for i in range(hp['conv_blocks']):
        if (hp['concave'] == True):
            multiplier = i + 1
        elif (hp['concave'] == False):
            multiplier = hp['conv_blocks'] - i

        if (i == 0):
            m.add(l.Conv1D(hp['conv_neurons']*multiplier, input_shape=features_shape, kernel_size=hyperparameters['kernel_size'], padding='same', kernel_initializer=hp['cnn_init']))
        elif (i > 0):
            m.add(l.Conv1D(hp['conv_neurons']*multiplier, kernel_size=hp['kernel_size'], padding='same', kernel_initializer=hp['cnn_init']))

        m.add(l.Activation('relu'))
        m.add(l.MaxPool1D(pool_size=hp['pool_size']))
        m.add(l.Dropout(0.4))

    m.add(l.Flatten())

    # Dense block.
    for i in range(hp['dense_blocks']):
        m.add(l.Dense(hp['dense_neurons']))
        m.add(l.BatchNormalization())
        m.add(l.Activation('relu'))
        m.add(l.Dropout(0.4))

    # Output layer.
    m.add(l.Dense(label_shape[0], activation='sigmoid'))
    return m

[12]:

def fn_train(model, loser, optimizer, samples_train, samples_evaluate, **hp):
    model.compile(
        optimizer=optimizer
        , loss=loser
        , metrics=['accuracy']
    )

    # Early stopping.
    metric_cuttoffs = [
        {"metric":"val_accuracy", "cutoff":0.90, "above_or_below":"above"},
        {"metric":"accuracy", "cutoff":0.90, "above_or_below":"above"},
        {"metric":"val_loss", "cutoff":1.00, "above_or_below":"below"},
        {"metric":"loss", "cutoff":1.00, "above_or_below":"below"}]
    cutoffs = TrainingCallback.Keras.MetricCutoff(metric_cuttoffs)

    # Training runs.
    model.fit(
        samples_train["features"]
        , samples_train["labels"]
        , validation_data = (
            samples_evaluate["features"]
            , samples_evaluate["labels"]
        )
        , verbose = 0
        , batch_size = hp['batch_size']
        , callbacks = [tf.keras.callbacks.History(), cutoffs]
        , epochs = hp['epoch_count']
    )
    return model

[13]:

hyperparameters = dict(
    concave         = [False]
    , conv_blocks   = [4]
    , conv_neurons  = [24]
    , pool_size     = [2]
    , kernel_size   = [3]
    , batch_size    = [8] #8 did best. tried 5 and 6 again, no.
    , cnn_init      = ['normal'] #default is glorot
    , dense_blocks  = [1]
    , dense_neurons = [32] #64 did well.
    , epoch_count   = [500]
)

[14]:

queue = aiqc.Experiment.make(
    # --- Analysis type ---
    library = "keras"
    , analysis_type = "classification_binary"

    # --- Model functions ---
    , fn_build = fn_build
    , fn_train = fn_train
    , fn_lose = None #auto
    , fn_optimize = None #auto
    , fn_predict = None #auto

    # --- Training options ---
    , repeat_count = 2
    , hyperparameters = hyperparameters
    , search_percent = None

    # --- Data source ---
    , splitset_id = img_splitset.id
    , foldset_id = None
    , hide_test = False
)

[15]:

queue.run_jobs()
